00040 // Version 1 had male priors with "m" appended to SNP name.
00041 // Version 2 has "-2" appended to SNP name for diploid priors, and "-1" appended for haploid.
00042 static const uint32_t kVersion = 2;
00043 static const uint32_t kMagicNumber = 71459;
00044 
00045 struct BinaryPriorsHeader {
00046   enum {kChipTypeLen = 31};
00047   uint32_t magic;
00048   uint32_t version;
00049   char chipType[kChipTypeLen + 1];
00050   uint32_t numPriors;
00051   uint32_t priorsFileOffset; // Offset from beginning of file where the priors start.
00052 };
00053 
00054 const char *BinaryPriorsReader::kDefaultChipType = "BI_SNP";
00055 
00056 bool BasicPriorsReader::nextPriorWithoutPloidySuffix(std::string* cur_name, Priors* cur_priors)
00057 {
00058   if (!nextPrior(cur_name, cur_priors)) {
00059     return false;
00060   }
00061   assert(endswith(cur_name->c_str(), "-1") || endswith(cur_name->c_str(), "-2"));
00062   *cur_name = cur_name->substr(0, cur_name->length() - 2);
00063   return true;
00064 }
00065 
00066 void
00067 BasicPriorsReader::writePriorsFile(std::string path, std::string chipType)
00068 {
00069   if (Util::stringEndsWith(path, ".tsv")) {
00070     writeTsvPriorsFile(path, chipType);
00071   } else if (Util::stringEndsWith(path, ".txt")) {
00072     writeTextPriorsFile(path, chipType);
00073   } else if (Util::stringEndsWith(path, ".priors")) {
00074     writeBinaryPriorsFile(path, chipType);
00075   } else {
00076     throw BroadException("Cant determine priors file format from the filename.", __FILE__, __LINE__, path.c_str());
00077   }
00078 }
00079 
00080 void
00081 BasicPriorsReader::writeTextPriorsFile(std::string path, std::string chipType)
00082 {
00083   // We ignore chipType -- there isnt space for it in the header.
00084   ofstream strm(path.c_str());
00085   std::string cur_name;
00086   Priors      cur_priors(MAX_NUM_CLUSTERS);
00087 
00088   startPriorIteration();
00089   while (nextPriorWithoutPloidySuffix(&cur_name, &cur_priors)) {
00090     strm << cur_name;
00091     // Reverse order of priors for writing to file.
00092     for (int i = cur_priors.getNumPriors() - 1; i >= 0 ; --i) {
00093       strm << ";" << cur_priors.getPrior(i).tostring();
00094     }
00095     strm << endl;
00096   }
00097   strm.close();
00098 }
00099 
00100 void BasicPriorsReader::writeTsvPriorsFile(std::string path, std::string chipType)
00101 {
00102   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00103   // this comes first...
00104   tsv.defineFile("probeset_id\tcopy_number\tBB\tAB\tAA");
00105   // add our meta info...
00106   tsv.addHeader("created-by", "birdseed/PriorsReader.cpp");
00107   tsv.addHeader("chip-type", chipType);
00108   // open for writing...
00109   tsv.writeTsv_v1(path);
00110 
00111   std::string cur_name;
00112   Priors      cur_priors(MAX_NUM_CLUSTERS);
00113 
00114   startPriorIteration();
00115   while (nextPriorWithoutPloidySuffix(&cur_name, &cur_priors)) {
00116     int num_priors = cur_priors.getNumPriors();
00117     assert((num_priors == 2) || (num_priors == 3));
00118     int copy_number = (num_priors == 2) ? 1 : 2; // change priors to copy number
00119     //
00120     tsv.set(0, "probeset_id", cur_name);
00121     tsv.set(0, "copy_number", copy_number);
00122     // Tsv uses whitespace to seperate columns.  Use ","s to join them.
00123     if (copy_number == 2) {
00124       tsv.set(0, "AA", cur_priors.getPrior(Priors::AA_INDEX).tostring(","));
00125       tsv.set(0, "AB", cur_priors.getPrior(Priors::AB_INDEX).tostring(","));
00126       tsv.set(0, "BB", cur_priors.getPrior(Priors::BB_INDEX).tostring(","));
00127     } else {
00128       tsv.set(0, "AA", cur_priors.getPrior(Priors::A_INDEX).tostring(","));
00129       tsv.set(0, "AB", "null");
00130       tsv.set(0, "BB", cur_priors.getPrior(Priors::B_INDEX).tostring(","));
00131     }
00132     tsv.writeLevel(0);
00133   }
00134 
00135   tsv.close();
00136 }
00137 
00138 void BasicPriorsReader::writeBinaryPriorsFile(std::string path, std::string chipType)
00139 {
00140   // whoops! too big.
00141   if (strlen(chipType.c_str()) > BinaryPriorsHeader::kChipTypeLen) {
00142     throw BroadException("ChipType string too long.", __FILE__, __LINE__);
00143   }
00144 
00145   // Create the header
00146   BinaryPriorsHeader header;
00147   // zero out the header
00148   memset(&header, 0, sizeof(header));
00149   header.magic = kMagicNumber;
00150   header.version =  kVersion;
00151   strncpy(header.chipType, chipType.c_str(), sizeof(header.chipType));
00152   header.numPriors = numPriors();
00153   header.priorsFileOffset = sizeof(header);
00154 
00155   FILE *fp = fopen_check(path.c_str(), "wb");
00156   fwrite_check(&header, sizeof(header), 1, fp);
00157 
00158   //
00159   std::string cur_name;
00160   Priors      cur_priors(MAX_NUM_CLUSTERS);
00161 
00162   startPriorIteration();
00163   while (nextPrior(&cur_name, &cur_priors) == true) {
00164     //
00165     if (cur_name.length() > kMaxPriorNameLen) {
00166       throw BroadException("Prior name too long", __FILE__, __LINE__, cur_name.c_str());
00167     }
00168     NamedPriors namedPriors(MAX_NUM_CLUSTERS);
00169     // zero out the struct...
00170     memset(namedPriors.priorName, 0, sizeof(namedPriors));
00171     // ... and fill it
00172     strcpy(namedPriors.priorName, cur_name.c_str());
00173     namedPriors.priors = cur_priors;
00174     //
00175     fwrite_check(&namedPriors, sizeof(namedPriors), 1, fp);
00176   }
00177   fclose_check(fp);
00178 }
00179 
00180 ///
00181 /// BasicMapPriorsReader methods.
00182 /// These are used by both Text and Tsv readers.
00183 ///
00184 void BasicMapPriorsReader::startPriorIteration()
00185 {
00186   priorIt = priorsMap.begin();
00187 }
00188 
00189 bool BasicMapPriorsReader::nextPrior(std::string* cur_name, Priors* cur_priors)
00190 {
00191   assert((cur_name != NULL) && (cur_priors != NULL));
00192 
00193   if (priorIt == priorsMap.end()) {
00194     cur_name->erase();  // clear out to be clean.
00195     return false;
00196   }
00197   // set the output vars and say ok.
00198   (*cur_name) = (*priorIt).first;
00199   (*cur_priors) = (*priorIt).second;
00200   priorIt++;
00201   return true;
00202 }
00203 
00204 const Priors* BasicMapPriorsReader::getPrior(const std::string &priorName)
00205 {
00206   PriorsMap::const_iterator it = priorsMap.find(priorName);
00207   if (it == priorsMap.end()) {
00208     Verbose::warn(2, string("Could not find prior in text priors file: ") + priorName);
00209     return NULL;
00210   }
00211   return &(*it).second;
00212 }
00213 
00214 const char* BasicMapPriorsReader::nextPriorName()
00215 {
00216   if (priorIt == priorsMap.end()) {
00217     return NULL;
00218   }
00219   return (*priorIt++).first.c_str();
00220 }
00221 
00222 size_t BasicMapPriorsReader::numPriors()
00223 {
00224   return priorsMap.size();
00225 }
00226 
00227 ///
00228 /// Text reader
00229 ///
00230 
00231 TextPriorsReader::TextPriorsReader(std::string path)
00232 {
00233   FILE *fp = fopen_check(path.c_str(), "r");
00234   char buf[10000];
00235 
00236   while (fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), fp) != NULL) {
00237     if (strlen(buf) >= sizeof(buf) - 1) {
00238       throw BroadException("Line too long in text priors file.", __FILE__, __LINE__, path.c_str());
00239     }
00240     const char *priorName = strtok(buf, ";");
00241     if (priorName == NULL || strlen(priorName) == 0) {
00242       throw BroadException("Error parsing text priors file.",  __FILE__, __LINE__, path.c_str());
00243     }
00244     Priors priors(MAX_NUM_CLUSTERS);
00245     // Finny produces priors in the reverse order of what Josh expects.
00246     for (int i = MAX_NUM_CLUSTERS - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
00247       const char *priorsString = strtok(NULL, ";");
00248       if (priorsString == NULL) {
00249         if (i == 0) {
00250           priors.setNumPriors(2);
00251           // JHG: "down" dont you mean "back"? And what is with the numeric constants?
00252           // Slide the priors down because we were populating them backwards.
00253           priors.setPrior(priors.getPrior(1), 0);
00254           priors.setPrior(priors.getPrior(2), 1);
00255           break;
00256         }
00257         throw BroadException("Error parsing text priors file.",  __FILE__, __LINE__, path.c_str());
00258       }
00259 
00260       priors.setPrior(Prior(priorsString), i);
00261     }
00262     assert(priors.getNumPriors() == 2 || priors.getNumPriors() == 3);
00263     // Mark the prior as diploid or haploid
00264     string strPriorName = priorName;
00265     if (strPriorName[strPriorName.length() - 1] == BIRDSEED_SUFFIX_CHAR) {
00266       strPriorName = strPriorName.substr(0, strPriorName.length() - 1);
00267     }
00268     if (priors.getNumPriors() == 2) {
00269       strPriorName += "-1";
00270     } else {
00271       strPriorName += "-2";
00272     }
00273 
00274     if (!priorsMap.insert(PriorsMap::value_type(strPriorName, priors)).second) {
00275       throw BroadException("Prior seen more than once text priors file.",  __FILE__, __LINE__, priorName);
00276     }
00277   }
00278   if (ferror(fp)) {
00279     throw BroadException("Error reading text priors file.", __FILE__, __LINE__, path.c_str(), errno);
00280   }
00281   fclose(fp);
00282 }
00283 
00284 ///
00285 /// Tsv reader functions.
00286 ///
00287 
00288 ///
00289 /// @brief     A helper function to decode a prior string into a prior object
00290 /// @param     prior     the prior to modify
00291 /// @param     str
00292 static void
00293 prior_set_from_string(Prior* prior, std::string& str)
00294 {
00295   assert(prior != NULL);
00296   // The string from the tsv file looks like:
00297   // "0.41626,0.20745,0.00303,0.00006,0.00066,210"
00298   // use an int to match "%u".
00299   int numObs;
00300   int rv = sscanf(str.c_str(), "%lf,%lf,%lf,%lf,%lf,%u",
00301                   &prior->m_mean[0], &prior->m_mean[1],
00302                   &prior->m_covarMatrix[0][0], &prior->m_covarMatrix[1][0], &prior->m_covarMatrix[1][1],
00303                   &numObs);
00304   // copy the int to the uint32_t
00305   prior->m_numObservations = numObs;
00306   // ok?
00307   if (rv != 6) {
00308     throw BroadException("Error parsing TSV prior", __FILE__, __LINE__, str.c_str());
00309   }
00310 
00311   // the diagonal is the same and not stored.
00312   prior->m_covarMatrix[0][1] = prior->m_covarMatrix[1][0];
00313 }
00314 
00315 const Priors* TsvPriorsReader::getPrior(const std::string &priorName)
00316 {
00317   PriorsMap::const_iterator it = priorsMap.find(priorName);
00318   if (it == priorsMap.end()) {
00319     // If this prior name has 0 copies (i.e. suffix of "-0") then
00320     // return null as prior file doesn't have entries for 0 copy snps
00321     // (i.e. chrY snps in females)
00322     int length = priorName.length();
00323     if (length > 2 && priorName[length-2] == '-' && priorName[length-1] == '0') {
00324       return NULL;
00325     }
00326     // Didn't find a prior complain
00327     Verbose::warn(2, "No prior for name: '" + priorName + "'. Perhaps you have the wrong model file?");
00328     return NULL;
00329   }
00330   return &(*it).second;
00331 }
00332 
00333 TsvPriorsReader::TsvPriorsReader(std::string path, std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> *probeSetsToLoad)
00334 {
00335   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00336   std::string f_probeset_id;
00337   int f_copy_number;
00338   string chip;
00339   if (tsv.open(path) != affx::TSV_OK) {
00340     string msg = "Couldn't open file: '" + path + "' to read.";
00341     throw BroadException(msg.c_str(), __FILE__, __LINE__);
00342   }
00343 
00344   // check the fields we what are there.
00345   // we allow "id" as a alias for "probeset_id"
00346   int probeset_id_cidx = tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probeset_id", "id");
00347   if (probeset_id_cidx < 0) {
00348     throw BroadException("Missing required column: ", __FILE__, __LINE__, "probeset_id");
00349   }
00350   int copy_number_cidx = tsv.cname2cidx(0, "copy_number");
00351   if (copy_number_cidx < 0) {
00352     throw BroadException("Missing required column: ", __FILE__, __LINE__, "copy_number");
00353   }
00354   // allow for case in column names.
00355   int aa_cidx = tsv.cname2cidx(0, "AA", "aa");
00356   if (aa_cidx < 0) {
00357     throw BroadException("Missing required column: ", __FILE__, __LINE__, "AA");
00358   }
00359   int ab_cidx = tsv.cname2cidx(0, "AB", "ab");
00360   if (ab_cidx < 0) {
00361     throw BroadException("Missing required column: ", __FILE__, __LINE__, "AB");
00362   }
00363   int bb_cidx = tsv.cname2cidx(0, "BB", "bb");
00364   if (bb_cidx < 0) {
00365     throw BroadException("Missing required column: ", __FILE__, __LINE__, "BB");
00366   }
00367 
00368   // fill the map from the TsvFile...
00369   while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == affx::TSV_OK) {
00370     Priors priors(MAX_NUM_CLUSTERS);
00371 
00372     tsv.get(0, probeset_id_cidx, f_probeset_id);
00373     tsv.get(0, copy_number_cidx, f_copy_number);
00374     // Skip probesets we aren't requested to load. If probeSetsToLoad is NULL read everything.
00375     if (probeSetsToLoad != NULL) {
00376       string name = f_probeset_id;
00377       if (name[name.length() - 1] == BIRDSEED_SUFFIX_CHAR) {
00378         name = name.substr(0, name.length()  - 1);
00379       }
00380       if (probeSetsToLoad != NULL && probeSetsToLoad->find(name.c_str()) == probeSetsToLoad->end())
00381         continue;
00382     }
00383 
00384     // only two values (1 or 2) allowed.
00385     if (f_copy_number == 1) {
00386       priors.setNumPriors(2);
00387     } else if (f_copy_number == 2) {
00388       priors.setNumPriors(3);
00389     } else { // opps!
00390       std::string err_str;
00391       tsv.get(0, copy_number_cidx, err_str);
00392       err_str = "'" + err_str + "' at " + path + ":" + ToStr(tsv.lineNumber());
00393       throw BroadException("Bad value for copynumber : ", __FILE__, __LINE__, err_str.c_str());
00394     }
00395 
00396     //
00397     std::string f_aa;
00398     Prior p_aa;
00399     tsv.get(0, aa_cidx, f_aa);
00400     prior_set_from_string(&p_aa, f_aa);
00401     priors.setPrior(p_aa, Priors::AA_INDEX); // AA_INDEX = 0, A_INDEX = 0
00402     //
00403     if (f_copy_number == 2) {
00404       std::string f_ab;
00405       Prior p_ab;
00406       tsv.get(0, ab_cidx, f_ab);
00407       prior_set_from_string(&p_ab, f_ab);
00408       priors.setPrior(p_ab, Priors::AB_INDEX); // AB_INDEX = 1
00409     }
00410     //
00411     std::string f_bb;
00412     Prior p_bb;
00413     tsv.get(0, bb_cidx, f_bb);
00414     prior_set_from_string(&p_bb, f_bb);
00415     priors.setPrior(p_bb, ((f_copy_number == 2) ? Priors::BB_INDEX : Priors::DiploidIndex(Priors::B_INDEX))); // BB_INDEX = 2, B_INDEX = 1;
00416 
00417     // to be compatible with legacy files chop off the 'm' if it exists.
00418     string name = f_probeset_id;
00419     if (name[name.length() - 1] == BIRDSEED_SUFFIX_CHAR) {
00420       name = name.substr(0, name.length()  - 1);
00421     }
00422     // Add to the map
00423     if (!priorsMap.insert(PriorsMap::value_type(name + "-" + ToStr(f_copy_number), priors)).second) {
00424       throw BroadException("Prior seen more than once text priors file.",  __FILE__, __LINE__, f_probeset_id.c_str());
00425     }
00426   }
00427   //
00428   tsv.close();
00429 }
00430 
00431 ///
00432 /// Binary prior reader funcs...
00433 ///
00434 
00435 BinaryPriorsReader::BinaryPriorsReader(std::string path, std::string expectedChipType):
00436     pMMap(NULL)
00437 {
00438   // We cant handle Binary format files on the sparc.
00439 #ifdef __sparc__
00440   printf("Binary format files cant be handled on a sparc at this time.\n"
00441          "Please ask a programmer to read 'birdseed/Prior.h' to find out why.\n");
00442   assert(0);
00443 #endif
00444 
00445   FILE *fp = fopen_check(path.c_str(), "rb");
00446   BinaryPriorsHeader header;
00447   fread_check(&header, sizeof(header), 1, fp);
00448   if (header.magic != kMagicNumber) {
00449     throw BroadException("Unexpected magic number in binary priors file.", __FILE__, __LINE__, path.c_str());
00450   }
00451   if (header.version != kVersion) {
00452     throw BroadException("Unexpected version number in binary priors file.", __FILE__, __LINE__, path.c_str());
00453   }
00454 
00455   // dont test if expectedChipType is blank.  (Due to force)
00456   if (strcmp(expectedChipType.c_str(), "") != 0) {
00457     if (strcmp(header.chipType, expectedChipType.c_str()) != 0) {
00458       std::stringstream strm;
00459       strm << "Actual chip type " << header.chipType << " different from expected chip type " << expectedChipType;
00460       throw BroadException(strm.str().c_str(), __FILE__, __LINE__);
00461     }
00462   }
00463 
00464   countPriors = header.numPriors;
00465   // Just mmap the whole file.  If the header gets too big we might change this
00466   mappedSize = header.priorsFileOffset + countPriors * sizeof(NamedPriors);
00467 
00468 #ifndef _MSC_VER
00469   // NYI -- Linux-specific
00470   pMMap = mmap(NULL, mappedSize, PROT_READ, MAP_SHARED, fileno(fp), 0);
00471   if (pMMap == (void *) - 1) {
00472     throw BroadException("mmap error.", __FILE__, __LINE__, path.c_str(), errno);
00473   }
00474   allPriors = (const NamedPriors *)((char *)pMMap + header.priorsFileOffset);
00475 #endif
00476 
00477   // File isn't closed in event of exception, but that is a fatal error anyway.
00478   // Does the file need to stay open for the duration of the mmap?
00479   fclose(fp);
00480 }
00481 
00482 BinaryPriorsReader::~BinaryPriorsReader()
00483 {
00484 #ifndef _MSC_VER
00485   // NYI -- Linux-specific
00486 #if !NDEBUG
00487   int ret =
00488 #endif
00489     munmap(pMMap, mappedSize);
00490   assert(ret == 0);
00491 #endif
00492 }
00493 
00494 static int namedPriorsCompare(const void *v1, const void *v2)
00495 {
00496   BinaryPriorsReader::NamedPriors *p1 = (BinaryPriorsReader::NamedPriors *)v1;
00497   BinaryPriorsReader::NamedPriors *p2 = (BinaryPriorsReader::NamedPriors *)v2;
00498 
00499   return strcmp(p1->priorName, p2->priorName);
00500 }
00501 
00502 
00503 const Priors *BinaryPriorsReader::getPrior(const std::string &priorName)
00504 {
00505   NamedPriors key(MAX_NUM_CLUSTERS);
00506   strncpy(key.priorName, priorName.c_str(), sizeof(key.priorName));
00507   // Shouldn't be necessary, but just to make sure
00508   key.priorName[sizeof(key.priorName) - 1] = '\0';
00509 
00510   NamedPriors *prior = (NamedPriors *)bsearch(&key, allPriors, countPriors, sizeof(NamedPriors), namedPriorsCompare);
00511   if (prior == NULL) {
00512     Verbose::warn(2, string("Could not find prior in binary priors file: ") + priorName);
00513     return NULL;
00514   }
00515   return &prior->priors;
00516 }
00517 
00518 // These methods override the Basic ones.
00519 // The binary uses a simple index to step through the contents.
00520 void BinaryPriorsReader::startPriorIteration()
00521 {
00522   priorIndex = 0;
00523 }
00524 
00525 bool BinaryPriorsReader::nextPrior(std::string* cur_name, Priors* cur_priors)
00526 {
00527   assert((cur_name != NULL) && (cur_priors != NULL));
00528 
00529   if (priorIndex >= countPriors) {
00530     cur_name->erase();
00531     return false;
00532   }
00533   // found one.
00534   (*cur_name) = allPriors[priorIndex].priorName;
00535   (*cur_priors) = allPriors[priorIndex].priors;
00536   priorIndex++;
00537   return true;
00538 }
00539 
00540 const char *BinaryPriorsReader::nextPriorName()
00541 {
00542   if (priorIndex >= countPriors) {
00543     return NULL;
00544   }
00545   return allPriors[priorIndex++].priorName;
00546 }
00547 
00548 size_t BinaryPriorsReader::numPriors()
00549 {
00550   return countPriors;
00551 }
00552 
00553 bool SnpPriorKey::ploidyDiffersByGender(const char *snpName) const
00554 {
00555   SpecialSnpMap::const_iterator iter = specialSnps.find(snpName);
00556   // If not in specialSnpMap, assumed to be diploid for both males & females
00557   if (iter == specialSnps.end()) {
00558     return false;
00559   }
00560   const std::pair<int, int> &p = iter->second;
00561   return (p.first != p.second);
00562 }
00563 // Return a string based on the number of chromosomes expected given the gender.
00564 // for example a chrX snp in males has 1 copy so expected is: 'snpname-1' and a
00565 // chrY snp in females has 0 copies so expected is: 'snpname-0'. regular autosomal
00566 // snps would be 'snpname-2'
00567 std::string SnpPriorKey::priorKeyForSnp(const std::string &snpName, Gender gender) const
00568 {
00569   std::string key;
00570   SpecialSnpMap::const_iterator iter = specialSnps.find(snpName);
00571   if (iter == specialSnps.end()) {
00572     key = snpName + "-2"; // "-2" for diploid by default.
00573     return key;
00574   } else {
00575     const std::pair<int, int> &p = iter->second;
00576     // same for men and women so just append it (i.e. mitochondiral snps)
00577     if (p.first == p.second) {
00578       key = snpName + "-" + ToStr(p.first);
00579       return key;
00580     }
00581     // give female key if unknown or female
00582     else if (gender == GENDER_FEMALE || gender == GENDER_UNKNOWN) {
00583       key = snpName + "-" + ToStr(p.second);
00584     }
00585     // give male key if male
00586     else if (gender == GENDER_MALE) {
00587       key = snpName + "-" + ToStr(p.first);
00588     } else {
00589       std::string msg1 = "Don't recognize gender: '" + ToStr(gender) + "'";
00590       std::string msg2 = " for snp: '" + snpName + "'";
00591       throw BroadException(msg1.c_str(), __FILE__, __LINE__, msg2.c_str());
00592     }
00593   }
00594   if (key.empty()) {
00595     std::string msg1 = " for snp: '" + snpName + "'";
00596     throw BroadException("Error. Can't determine key.", __FILE__, __LINE__, msg1.c_str());
00597   }
00598   return key;
00599 }
00600 /******************************************************************/
00601 /**************************[END OF PriorsReader.cpp]*************************/
